message_1: Find all the quadratic residues of 17.
message_2:
A quadratic residue modulo a prime number p is an integer that is congruent to a perfect square modulo p. In other words, a number x is a quadratic residue modulo 17 if there exists an integer y such that x ≡ y^2 (mod 17).

To find all the quadratic residues of 17, we can calculate the squares of the numbers from 0 to 16 modulo 17:

0^2 ≡ 0 (mod 17)
1^2 ≡ 1 (mod 17)
2^2 ≡ 4 (mod 17)
3^2 ≡ 9 (mod 17)
4^2 ≡ 16 (mod 17)
5^2 ≡ 8 (mod 17)
6^2 ≡ 2 (mod 17)
7^2 ≡ 15 (mod 17)
8^2 ≡ 13 (mod 17)
9^2 ≡ 13 (mod 17)
10^2 ≡ 15 (mod 17)
11^2 ≡ 2 (mod 17)
12^2 ≡ 8 (mod 17)
13^2 ≡ 16 (mod 17)
14^2 ≡ 9 (mod 17)
15^2 ≡ 4 (mod 17)
16^2 ≡ 1 (mod 17)

Now, we can list the distinct residues:

0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 9, 13, 15, 16

So, the quadratic residues of 17 are {0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 9, 13, 15, 16}.
